question: Which are the only three nations share the location of "Sudetes Mountain Range"?
explanation: The Czech Republic, Poland and Germany share the location of Sudetes Mountain Range. This mountain range, located in Central Europe, is the highest part of the Bohemian Massif. The topographical relief features of the Sudetes is similar to the mountains of North Europe. Mount Snezka is the highest point of this mountain range. Elbe, Oder, Spree, Morava, Lusatian Neisse and Easter Neisse, Jizera and Kwisa rivers originates from this mountain range.
